EmailTemplate.name: Global_Event_Spring IO_Barcelona_Q216.Post-event - Attended 6-1-16
EmailTemplate.subject: Thank You for Joining Pivotal at Spring I/O Barcelona 2016
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Hi {{lead.First Name:default=there}}
Thanks for joining Pivotal and the Spring community at Spring I/O! We hope you enjoyed spending time with Spring community leaders and learning how enterprises are adopting Cloud Native Java to drive modern, software experiences for their customers.
Start your Cloud Native journey on the Cloud Native microsite <[[http://pivotal.io/cloud-native]]> to learn why it matters, and how to become Cloud Native. Then get hands on <[[http://pivotal.io/platform/pcf-tutorials/getting-started-with-pivotal-cloud-foundry]]> Spring on a Cloud Native Platform! And remember to pick up your free copy of the O’Reilly eBook, Migrating to Cloud Native Applications <[[http://pivotal.io/platform/migrating-to-cloud-native-application-architectures-ebook]]> on the Pivotal site.
In case you missed some of the amazing Pivotal speakers, here’s a quick recap:
- KEYNOTE – FROM SPRING FRAMEWORK 4.3 TO 5.0 <[[http://2016.springio.net/keynote-from-spring-framework-4-3-to-5-0/]]> - CLOUD NATIVE JAVA JOSH LONG <[[http://2016.springio.net/cloud-native-java/]]> - 10 WAYS TO GET SUPER-PRODUCTIVE WITH SPRING BOOT BRIAN CLOZEL AND STÉPHANE NICOLL <[[http://2016.springio.net/10-ways-to-get-super-productive-with-spring-boot]]> - SPRING CLOUD *: EXLORING SPRING CLOUD IMPLEMENTATIONS SPENCER GIBB <[[http://2016.springio.net/spring-cloud-exploring-spring-cloud-implementations/]]> - WHAT’S NEW IN SPRING DATA? OLIVER GIERKE <[[http://2016.springio.net/whats-new-in-spring-data/]]> - MODERN JAVA COMPONENT DESIGN WITH SPRING 4.3 JUERGEN HOELLER <[[http://2016.springio.net/modern-java-component-design-with-spring-4-3/]]> - DEVELOPING A GEOSPATIAL WEBSERVICE WITH KOTLIN AND SPRING BOOT SÉBASTIEN DELEUZE <[[http://2016.springio.net/developing-a-geospatial-webservice-with-kotlin-and-spring-boot/]]> - KEYNOTE – DESIGNING APPLICATIONS: THE REACTIVE WAY ROSSEN STOYANCHEV AND STEPHANE MALDINI <[[http://2016.springio.net/keynote-designing-applications-the-reactive-way/]]> - FROM IMPERATIVE TO REACTIVE ROSSEN STOYANCHEV <[[http://2016.springio.net/from-imperative-to-reactive/]]> - TEST-DRIVEN DOCUMENTATION WITH SPRING REST DOCS ANDY WILKINSON <[[http://2016.springio.net/test-driven-documentation-with-spring-rest-docs/]]> - 40 TIPS & TRICKS FOR SPRING IN INTELLIJ IDEA YANN CÉBRON ANDSTÉPHANE NICOLL <[[http://2016.springio.net/40-tips-tricks-for-spring-in-intellij-idea/]]> - KEEP CALM AND PUSH APPS-AAS SERGIU BODIU <[[http://2016.springio.net/keep-calm-and-push-apps-aas/]]> - SPRING 4 WEB APPS AND BEYOND ROSSEN STOYANCHEV <[[http://2016.springio.net/spring-4-web-apps-and-beyond/]]> - CONSUMPTION FOR DEVICES WITH SPRING CLOUD & NETFLIX OSS - MARK HECKLER <[[http://2016.springio.net/living-on-the-edge-service-bundling-microservices-to-optimize-consumption-for-devices-with-spring-cloud-netflix-oss/]]> - DISTRIBUTED TRACING: HOW TO FIND LATENCY IN PRODUCTION SYSTEMS DAVE SYER <[[http://2016.springio.net/distributed-tracing-how-to-find-latency-in-production-systems/]]> - SPRING INTEGRATION WITH SPRING BOOT AND RABBITMQ GARY RUSSELL <[[http://2016.springio.net/spring-integration-with-spring-boot-and-rabbitmq/]]> - TESTING SPRING BOOT APPLICATIONS PHIL WEBB <[[http://2016.springio.net/testing-spring-boot-applications/]]> - CLOUD-NATIVE STREAMING AND EVENT-DRIVEN MICROSERVICES MARIUS BOGOEVICI <[[http://2016.springio.net/cloud-native-streaming-and-event-driven-microservices/]]>
Stay in touch with the Spring Team at Pivotal and join the conversation on our blogs <[[http://spring.io/blog]]>, podcasts <[[http://blog.pivotal.io/podcasts-pivotal]]>, and on Twitter <[[https://twitter.com/springcentral]]>. We hope to see you again soon at a future event!
Thanks,
The Pivotal Team
